properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 12 at 3:40AM PST until January 17 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Reno NV
properties.description:
* CHANGES...Added a winter storm watch for Wednesday night through
Thursday night. Advisory for Monday night into Tuesday morning
remains unchanged.

* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total
snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches, with amounts over 6 inches
possible in higher terrain west of Susanville and Portola. Winds
gusting as high as 50 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy
snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches, except
8 to 18 inches west of Highway 395 possible. Winds could gust
as high as 50 mph.

* WHERE...Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 4 PM Monday to 4
AM PST Tuesday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Wednesday
evening through late Thursday night.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions Monday evening
through Tuesday morning, which could impact the commute. Gusty
winds could lead to low visibility situations. Travel could be
very difficult to impossible Wednesday night into Thursday with
near zero visibility and long delays possible.
properties.instruction:
Monday-Tuesday: Even light snowfall causes major travel delays,
especially during periods of high traffic volume. Be sure to allow
extra time to reach your destination. Leave extra space between
vehicles since it takes longer to stop on slick roadways.

Wednesday Night-Thursday:Now is the time to prepare an emergency
kit for your home and car. If traveling consider alternate plans,
remember to carry tire chains, extra food, water and clothing.
Once the storm arrives, travel may be difficult or impossible for
an extended period of time.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM MONDAY TO 4 AM PST TUESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT
